intro: Neonauclea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine neonauclea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
